wikipedia_page.main: Michael Pearce (born 1933) is an author of historical fiction and police procedurals.

response: The Mamur Zapt is the protagonist of an award-winning series of historical fiction police procedurals, written by Sudanese-born novelist Michael Pearce. The novels are set in Cairo at the turn of the twentieth century. Egypt was ruled notionally by a khedive but the British administered the country at the time. Rather than being a specific person, "Mamur Zapt" was the official title of the head of the Cairo secret police. Pearce filled this role with Gareth Cadwallader Owen, a Welsh army captain.

* A Dead Man in Tangier by Michael Pearce – Sandor Seymour, an officer of Scotland Yard's Special Branch, is sent to investigate a murdered diplomat in Tangier, during the era immediately preceding World War I.

link_mentions.page: List of authors published as UK first editions by Collins Crime Club

response: * "The Mamur Zapt and the Catherine Wheel" by Michael Pearce
